skill.name: Resume Bullet Extraction
skill.description: Auto-invoke after task completion to generate powerful resume bullet points from completed work.
skill.summary: Auto-invoke after task completion to generate powerful resume bullet points from completed work.
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill. No code execution, no file access, no network calls, no environment variable access. Provides resume writing guidance through templates and formulas only.

content.user_title: Generate Impactful Resume Bullets from Completed Work
content.value_statement: Software engineers struggle to translate technical work into compelling resume content. This skill transforms completed tasks into powerful, quantified resume bullet points using proven formulas.
actual_capabilities: Generate resume bullets using action verb + accomplishment + technology + impact formula
Quantify achievements with specific metrics and business impact
Apply templates for feature implementation, performance optimization, bug fixes, and architecture decisions
Identify the most impressive aspects of completed technical work
limitations: Does not access or modify your actual resume files
Does not integrate with external job platforms or application systems
Does not provide career coaching beyond resume bullet writing
Cannot verify information against job descriptions automatically

use_cases.title: Document Technical Impact
use_cases.description: After completing a feature, instantly generate a polished resume bullet that highlights your contribution and technologies used.

use_cases.title: Track Team Accomplishments
use_cases.description: Systematically capture project outcomes with quantifiable metrics for performance reviews and career advancement.

use_cases.title: Update Application Materials
use_cases.description: Transform any completed work item into a compelling bullet point that passes ATS systems and impresses technical interviewers.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a resume bullet for building a new feature using [technology] that [describe what it does].

prompt_templates.title: Performance Work
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a resume bullet for optimizing [component] by [method], resulting in [metric improvement].

prompt_templates.title: Bug Resolution
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a resume bullet for resolving [problem] through [solution], preventing [impact].

prompt_templates.title: Complete Story
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all significant resume bullets from this completed work [paste work summary], focusing on technical depth and quantifiable impact.

output_examples.input: I just finished implementing a new authentication system with JWT tokens and refresh token rotation using Node.js and Redis. It handles 50,000 daily users and eliminated all session hijacking vulnerabilities.
output: Engineered JWT authentication with refresh token rotation using Node.js and Redis, eliminating session hijacking vulnerabilities and supporting 50,000+ daily active users
Architected secure authentication system reducing vulnerability surface by implementing token refresh mechanics and Redis-based session storage

best_practices: Always quantify impact with specific numbers, percentages, or scale metrics
Include specific technologies and technical context in every bullet
Start with strong action verbs that demonstrate ownership and initiative
anti_patterns: Using passive language like 'Responsible for' or 'Helped with'
Writing generic bullets without specific technologies or metrics
Including jargon that non-technical recruiters cannot understand

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works across all conversation contexts.

faq.question: What makes a strong resume bullet?
faq.answer: Strong bullets use action verbs, specific technologies, quantifiable impact, and demonstrate ownership of outcomes.

faq.question: How do I integrate this into my workflow?
faq.answer: Auto-invoke after task completion. Paste your work summary and receive polished bullets ready for your resume.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no file access or data collection. All processing happens within your AI conversation.

faq.question: Why are my bullets coming out vague?
faq.answer: Provide more specific details about technologies used, scale achieved, and measurable outcomes from your work.

faq.question: How is this different from other resume tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on technical impact quantification specifically for engineers, using proven STAR methodology.
